Patch Set 38:

Patch Set 38:

(1 comment)

Patch Set 38:

(1 comment)

Abandoned

An equivalent feature has been merged, https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libpldm/+/75733
Thanks Unive. I'm going to take a little bit of time to experiment with the iteration thought I had. I'll report back.

Hi Unive,

So I've done another sketch for your consideration:

https://gist.github.com/amboar/3c934d9e2e5383226d4975892e5dee89

I think this is my preferred approach over splitting the API to handle the allocation as we have here (which I suggested to you in a previous sketch of related APIs: https://gist.github.com/amboar/c82ea6a9217d4d786b92733c0af7a451).

I want to be clear that I'm not flip-flopping just to be disruptive, rather, these thoughts have emerged over time. I've polled a couple of people on the iterator concept and it's held up so far (with some tweaks suggested).

If you don't find it distasteful I'm happy to do the rework your change here (and please accept my apologies for having you chase the first sketch).

Hi Andrew,

> If you don't find it distasteful I'm happy to do the rework your change here (and please accept my apologies for having you chase the first sketch).

For now I'm rushing on another portion of PLDM Firmware update develoment and probably need your help this time.

> I want to be clear that I'm not flip-flopping just to be disruptive, rather, these thoughts have emerged over time. I've polled a couple of people on the iterator concept and it's held up so far (with some tweaks suggested).

I would love to make all of these wonderful but unfortunately not allowed by the time limit. (Sorry I haven't tell you I have that concern so far) 
PLDM formal update development is a long distance running but this patch is the first step of all, there is still a long chain of patches floating in the air because there isn't a stable design to depend on, so I hope this is our last time spining around this patch.
I'm fully supported to make things better, but perhaps we can start a new ABI cycle to achieve that next time.

> So I've done another sketch for your consideration:
> 
> https://gist.github.com/amboar/3c934d9e2e5383226d4975892e5dee89

Let me take some time to read it and give feedbeck to you, thank's for your work anyway.

>So I've done another sketch for your consideration:
https://gist.github.com/amboar/3c934d9e2e5383226d4975892e5dee89

I'm back, this idea is just awesome, wipes out all of the concern with miscalculating the space needed, and even easier to view than previous one.

Let me apologize for my rude in the previous comment, if it can let this whole thing going faster and easier, I'm all in.
